item.title: üìï Coming Soon! Exploring the Metaverse
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: In the world of tech buzzwords, ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù has been topic of discussion, largely understood and misunderstood. item.title: Getting into the Metaverse ‚Äî Part 1
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: Metaverse is the most enquired word after Facebook renamed itself to ‚ÄúMeta‚Äù to align to their metaversal vision. In the novel, people use digital avatars of themselves to explore the online world, often as a way of escaping a dystopian reality. Today, Metaverse is being considered as a $800 billion path with double digit growth in next 5 years, where industry is trying to get most out of it by co-creating with communities, and focusing on it‚Äôs cost-effective universal acceptance.

item.description: Modern enterprises must manage multiple layers of complexity across thousands of assets, workflows, and processes ‚Äî and there‚Äôs near-zero tolerance for issues that interrupt operations, damage profitability, or put workers‚Äô safety at risk. item.title: Enterprise XR - Multi-Factor Authentication
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: XR use cases are growing with advancements in the devices, internet and development technologies. There is an ever-growing demand to build enterprise use cases using ARVR technology. Most enterprise use cases eventually require integration with an enterprise ecosystem such as IAM (Identity and Access Management), ERP, CRM, and single sign-on with other systems. Most organizations protect digital assets with a single sign-on using Multiple Factor Authentication (MFA). The MFA is generally a web-browser based authentication where the browser redirects to tenant‚Äôs authentication page where the user provides their credentials and then the user confirms another factor (PIN, OTP, SMS or mobile notifications), once it succeeds, it gets redirected back to the protected resource.
